text: trading options can be incredibly lucrative however if you're anything like me when I first started I just kind of started trading and unfortunately that led to a bunch of wasted time and effort so the goal of this video is to share nine questions I would ask myself if I were to start trading options all over again and no this isn't to confirm whether or not options are right for me to trade because they are it's to make sure that I'm going down the right path because it is so easy easy not to Let's dig right in taking a look at the first three this first question is no mistake do you understand the trouble that you're in and it sounds a little dramatic but here is the long and short of it the vast majority of Traders fail we know this there's all different kinds of statistics on it you can find a lot of data on it on my website here are a list of studies that you can check out that report the behavior and the results of most Traders so why do I bring this up if I already know that I want to trade but I know that a lot of people fail at it well two reasons the first one is in order to succeed at something that's incredibly difficult you have to understand how difficult it is so that you can then conduct the proper preparation in order to

text: uh from 2018 to 22 was 24.6 on average and my compound annual growth rate from 2007 is in the 20 range and this is 72190 apparently I have a lot of work to do really the point being is people can per way better than me to be clear and a lot of people should I've approached trading very specifically with the intent of doing well but consistently I've only had two down years my first two and both of them are less than 5 draw Downs so yeah I have a different objective but the point I'm trying to make is that a lot of people get into this with the idea of making a small amount of money they're taught not to be greedy they think they're doing that but once you actually start looking at the numbers a little bit you're like okay you're actually setting yourself up for failure right from the jump so you have to answer this question before you move on to the next three why are you different what are you going to do different than all of these people what are you going to do different than the 90 plus group of people that try to do this and fail and it can't be something as simple as I'm going to try hard I'm going to study hard lots of them do that you have to go further than that and one of the things I want you to start

text: products and to learn what this is is not easy it's all delayed gratification it's your first 5 years your first eight years you're not going to see much you might trade really well you might be growing your money but if you're like me and you start without a lot of money even if you have a great return it's not going to move the line really that much as a gross dollar amount so you have to think about you what are you really good at are you good at pattern recognition do you see things over time and you can start to catch patterns that continue to reoccur you'll find that in the market all the time are you really good at being objective with yourself we'll get into that a little bit later but one of the biggest downfalls Traders have is literally the inability to control themselves and that's a massive draw down so think about that as we proceed forward what are you good at and how does that make you different than most people who try this and fail next three questions you probably caught some of this from what I was just talking about but how serious are you about doing this because a lot of people will start trading like I'll just throw some money in and see how it goes and it's gone it's fine you could do that it does like okay but trading especially as a wealth development

text: talking about but how serious are you about doing this because a lot of people will start trading like I'll just throw some money in and see how it goes and it's gone it's fine you could do that it does like okay but trading especially as a wealth development vehicle is a terrible hobby because you have to wear so many hats as an individual retail Trader you have to research things you have to be a data analyst to look through a bunch of data you have to be a technical analyst to be able to look at charts you also have to be your own counselor and psychologist because guess what out of all of the people that interact with the stock market we all have access to the same information you have access to the same information I do yet 90 plus of Traders fail within 5 years I haven't I've obviously outperformed the market for that time frame is it because I have better tools better information no so what does it come down to it comes down to the way that I manage myself the way I understand myself and the way that I'm able to Bear myself to myself what I mean by that is we have an ego and it's very difficult to manage the ego and it leads to things like the disposition effect where we take winning trades down too fast because we want to realize the gain and then

text: a vehicle there's something we can trade their uh type of security SO trading options doesn't equal making money you have to figure out what is the money making are you going to be good at trading directionally are you good at finding breakouts are you good at finding that have increasing volume and institutional support and you're able to follow that are you able to analyze broad Market data sets and find inefficiencies like variance risk premiums that you can capitalize on they're all out there they exist it's one of the beautiful things about being a retail Trader is you get to check about a lot of different boxes and find what works for you but simply trading options is not a way that you make money actually for most people for being honest it's a way to lose money why haven't you started a trading plan and trading log this is is simple if you haven't done them do them I have a video in the notes that will walk through both of them in depth but as you notice you have to do a lot of things the idea that you're going to be able to do all of those things and just memorize it really organized in your mind and perform well is wild even if over time you don't really refer to your trading plan all the time I don't but going through the exercise of building it is so important last three questions
